scenario: Stryker Corporation SYK agreed to acquire Inari Medical Inc. NARI for $80 per share in cash, representing a total fully diluted equity value of approximately $4.9 billion. The acquisition will strengthen Stryker's peripheral vascular position in the growing segment of venous thromboembolism (VTE). VTE impacts up to 900,000 lives in the United States annually, with a $6 billion segment opportunity in the U.S. and 20%+ annual growth expected. Inari's 2024 sales are estimated at around $603 million, reflecting 20%+ growth from 2023. The acquisition will be funded with cash on hand and debt, and is expected to close by the end of the first quarter of 2025. The expected impacts to 2025 financial results will be discussed on Stryker's upcoming fourth quarter 2024 earnings call. NARI stock is up 21% at $78.65, and SYK stock is down 1.76% at $355 during the premarket session.
